rulesPage.title: How to Play
rulesPage.intro: Welcome to Fantasy Legislative Yuan! Compete with friends by drafting Taiwanese legislators and earning points based on their real legislative activities.

step1.title: 1. Create or Join a League
step1.description: Start by creating a new league or joining an existing one with friends.

step2.title: 2. Draft Your Team
step2.description: Participate in a snake draft to build your roster of 9 legislators (6 starters + 3 bench).

step3.title: 3. Manage Your Roster
step3.description: Set your starting lineup, make trades, and pick up/drop players throughout the season.

step4.title: 4. Compete Weekly
step4.description: Face off against other teams in head-to-head matchups. The team with the most points wins!

scoring.title: Scoring System
scoring.description: Points are awarded based on real legislative activities

writtenInterpellations.description: Submitting written questions to government officials

maverickBonus.title: Maverick Bonus
maverickBonus.description: Voting against party line on roll calls

scoring.title: Scoring
scoring.description: Only your 6 starting legislators earn points for your team. Bench players do not contribute to your weekly score.

leave.title: Leave Status
leave.description: Legislators on leave (marked with <badge></badge>) do not earn points while absent.

moves.title: Roster Moves
moves.description: You can pick up free agents and drop players from your roster at any time. When your roster is full, you must drop a player to add a new one.

snake.description: The draft order reverses each round. For example, with 4 teams:

queue.title: Draft Queue
queue.description: Before the draft, you can create a ranked preference list of legislators. During the draft, the system will automatically pick the highest-ranked available legislator from your queue.

auto.title: Auto-Draft
auto.description: If your preference queue is empty, the system will randomly select an available legislator for you.

schedule.title: Schedule
schedule.description: Each week runs from Monday to Sunday. Teams are matched up in head-to-head competitions.

winning.title: Winning
winning.description: The team with the most total points from their 6 starters wins the matchup.

standings.title: Standings
standings.description: Teams are ranked by wins, losses, and total points scored throughout the season.

average.title: Check Average Scores
average.description: Look at legislators' average points per week to identify consistent performers.

bench.title: Manage Your Bench
bench.description: Keep active legislators on your bench in case starters go on leave.

activity.title: Monitor Activity
activity.description: Check the Activity feed to see recent pickups and drops by other teams.

diversify.title: Diversify Your Team
